com.ibm.watson.dsm.engine.app

Class DSMEngine

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ibm.watson.dsm.util.AbstractListenerManager<IEvaluationListener,java.util.List<TupleState>,java.lang.Object,java.lang.Boolean>
      • com.ibm.watson.dsm.engine.AbstractRuleEngine
        • com.ibm.watson.dsm.engine.app.DSMEngine
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IRuleEngine
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    GaianRuleEngine

    public class DSMEngine
extends AbstractRuleEngine
implements IRuleEngine
    Extends the super class to use SharedTuplePlatform to implement the exchange of transport tuples between platforms, and thus engines. It also adds the PEERS table to the evaluation context. The PEERS tables contains a NODE_ID column containing the instance id of a reachable peer. It also contains a RELATIONSHIP column that for each NODE_ID, contains a single topology relationship.
    Author:
    dawood

      Create the distributed platform with the given inputs, and if the storage is null, then use the one configured in DSMConfig (the constructor requires storage to not be null).

      Overrides the super class to populate the system tables before calling the super class and to send monitoring events if enabled.

      Log the current state of the input, persistent and transport tuples using a StateChangeEvent.

      Return the tuple storage that the engine will use.

      If this returns true, then monitoring calls will be made during rule evaluation.

      See if the engine is started.

      Check to see if the population of peers has changed, and if so, make another evaluation.
      protected void sendTransportTuples(NamedTuples tuplesToSend)
      Store the tuples in the platform, triggering notification to subscribing peers, then delete them (outside of the platform) so they don't persist in the storage and no notification is sent.
      void start()
      Start the super class then the shared tuple platform, and set the platform up to: exchange transport tuples with other engines receive TupleMessages from the TupleAdmin
      void stop()
      Stop the engine and any threads created during it's use.
